reasoning: Also known as DOOR syndrome or Eronen syndrome. Extremely rare autosomal recessive disorder with ~50 documented cases globally. Prevalence estimated as <1 per million. Characterized by absence of distal phalanges, renal defect, and cerebral anomalies. Using prevalence metric for lifelong genetic condition. Low confidence due to limited epidemiological data based primarily on case reports.
source: Orphanet rare disease registry, case report literature
